name: Lamppost
text:
They are the noiseless, the soundless,/
Strung together/
These phantom globes silently stretch/
Toward an unseen horizon,/
Casting a pale shadow, a dead light on hazy ground./
Defying the dark and infinite shroud,/
They are the peace, the quiet,/
The silently pulsating calm./

name: María
text:
It floats, slows down, stops, retreats.
Perception staggers with the inconsistent flux of time
As mind wanders, fuzzy and numb,
And body disintegrates into the swirling quicksand
That surrounds and usurps the senses,
Dissipating known and unknown forms.
Evoked by the bliss of vertigo
And oneiric shadows of sound,
Drooping eyelids invite this dream,
Injecting a subtle soporific syringe
Deep into lyrical maelstroms
That know not the stylistic Shades
Nor the thrill of the third paroxysm.
Indeed, as they say, out from a cloudy haze
Emerges a buoyant subconscious,
Laboriously drawn forth by the inexplicable pleasure
Of having loosed the very fabric of being.
Intrigue, infinity, and the metaphysics of Mephistopheles,
Yes, even language and her sweetly disposed nullification
Intrinsically mesh and burn together
To create the microcosm of the blazed,
To unveil the fool and his folly.

name: Shimmer
text:
There it goes…
Don’t let it disappear amongst the 
Whispering boughs, sliding away 
In the softly dimming, refracting
Sunset.  Grasp it.  Hold it.  Kiss it.
In a fraction of a moment, it will
Fall through the frivolous gaps
In your half-clenched fist,
And not a word 
Will be spoken.

name: Un
text:
In an unfortunate dissection of light,
Thirteen beams were splintered,
Shattered and shot into oblivion.
‘Twas a most regrettable occurrence
Engendered by the spatial limitations
Of some cluttered mind and a heavy soul.
Disappearing into obsolete Xanadus,
Most rays unsurprisingly remained afar.
After all, their collective was prime,
Their fate unintended, and their skill
Melodically unquestioned.

Yet one odd purveyor of iniquities,
Stricken by the throes of insomnia, 
(Chance affliction of madmen and kings)
Finally dreamt in jubilant ekstasis
Of the familiar fragrance of jasmine.
In a euphoric, unforgettable silence,
He halted.  Sweet memory infused
The spectral creature with unquenchable
Desire, and in a single infinite bound,
Recalling a singular path, the ray returned,
Piercing through the untold darkness.

name: Ajedrez
text:
Careful as you move 
Twisting those bare, knotted knuckles.
Slice the diagonal with the precision of a surgeon,
Calm and serene, como la mariposa
Landing in the shade of boundless grass.
Your mind doesn’t simply dissect this move.
It ponders and engulfs the move of this move:
The fifth, fifteenth and fiftieth iterations
Cycle like clockwork through your synapses.
No longer just another unfortunate, 
burdensome acquaintance,
Time is your friend.
Feel the levity, the sterile clarity
As your index finger and bony thumb
Clench the finely bristled mane.
Know that this has been done before.
Know that this will happen again.
For the variation is no longer
That simple infinity of your father’s father,
Though the symmetry remains the same.
Pause a moment: the positions are set,
The lingering pieces now frozen in place.
A delicate whisper floats upon the board:
Jaque mate señor, jaque mate.

name: Waves
text:
Softly now, a melody caresses the languid room:
It wafts in and out, high and low,
Traipsing aural boundaries 
With slight, swift staccatos 
Silenced by these slender, smooth legatos.	
Sometimes, just sometimes, I hear the whirl:
A fluid rush of flesh slicing the air,
Of fingers gliding ‘cross the keys.
They whisper, feel, dance, sing –
Enraptured by the movement,
Drawn precariously into the moment
I watch the world fluctuate,
Rising, falling, rising and falling
With every warm breath,
With each flickering lash.

name: Bough
text:
To ascend with ease, to slip
Through unnoticed, swaying
With silent precision to the
Hidden rhythms of the breeze;
To glide transcendentally
Along soft, natural spirals,
As summery warmth abounds
And bounces, fading into shade:
Herein lies that tranquil gloss
Of jade inlaid with amethyst.
Yes herein lies that peaceful calm
Of sweetened soothing jasmine wisps.

name: Carpe
text:
Skip the shadowy introductions
Interlaced with a mindless aura
Of necessity, carelessly invoking
A weary ritual of bygone days.
Go headlong into the fiery rush
Of adrenaline burning slender veins
Pumping overpowering sensations
With each tingling passion piercing
Every little fibrous nerve.
Shake the dust of dying books.

name: Willow
text:
My eyes unfocused used to peer
Past droning highways’ woven ways,
Past curving roads which disappear
Into a blue forgotten haze.

My mind unbridled used to dream
Of jasmine, jade and amethyst,
Of glass and onyx crystal streams
Imbued with fragrant ambergris.

Yet once beneath the shade I lay,
Alone and spent, in filthy sweat,
No will to stir, to sleep, to pray;
Hushed by fear, by crushing regret.

With fevered thoughts, my mind did brood,
Thru stifled air and reckless heat: 
No pain, no sting could I elude,
A victim of my own deceit.

Still, clear above, I grew aware,
A faceless wind, a smooth embrace,
A peaceful bliss was gifted there,
With floating, mellow, silent grace.

Suspended by some drifting daze,
Dipping slightly with the breeze,
Dipping toward my vacant gaze:
A willow’s vaguely rhythmic ease.

name: Vagrant
text:
Disappearing into neglected woods,
Past a dirt path toward a tangle of trees,
I scraped and I struggled
Through spiraling thorns embedded
In bark, in shade, in flesh.
For some troubled time, I shuffled and turned,
I twisted and ducked, contortedly
Forging the wooded trail.

With sweat on my lips and dust on my tongue,
I wiped my brow, as fingers unfurled.
Over thinning twigs and fallen trees,
With a final ascent, I reached for plains,
Open in air, searching the sky
Its simple blue drifting through
My ever-wandering, hazy eye.

name: Catharsis
text:
Silver and fire dripped in syrupy orbs
Down the sky’s wide chest
Into a wrinkled plain yearning
For a departure from spent cartridges,
Spilt by steel barrels
Exploding anger toward the clouds.
As if in a hazy dreamscape
Defined by the synaptic blue,
Trees more surreal than Dali’s
Swayed to dance and catch
Each gleaming globule floating
Through the viscous canvas.		
Over the smiling face of sunny waters,
Defined within the mind of Hiawatha,
This bewildering array rained forth
From the firmament in laborious
Repetition and silent premonition
Of morphing moths into dragonflies.
Like fog thinning in a waking jungle,
The dimming numbness slid away
As drip, drop, drip, drop agápe
Bathed the earth in susurrus tones.

name: Dreamscape
text:
I sometimes take a wayward glance,
A careless tilt to the unlit night,
Where subtle thoughts reach from within,
Where clouds crafted from cotton
Thin out in delicate strands.
Swimming with quivering breath,
The stars begin to wax, to wane, to wax, to wane,
As a lonesome train bellows in haste
To the faded sky.

I find a peace, a careful solemnity
In this strolling rite,
Where a gleaming river passes by,
And a coin’s quick arc disappears.
For the night is filled with hazy things:
A half-caught glimpse and startled sight.
For better or worse, recollected or not,
I see the sleepless mare and sweetened soul
That stir and dance beneath this moon.

name: Cosmos
text:
Observe how a sphere,
Wrapped in a diaphanous skin,
Mirrors the world in its truer form:
Distortions abound in broken matrices
As the eye of the beholder finds itself
Perpetually frozen in the center,
Eternally locked in the pivot,
Of his myopic globe.

name: Journey
text:
Mesmerizing: fractals of leaves were forgotten,
Dropped in the past by a passing wind
While prayers drifted, ceaseless,
And empty spaces began to drown.
I suppose there was not a great deal of time
Without boulders slowly breaking,
Grinding down to dusted earth.
Although sacred muds of certain shores
Maintain their fluid form,
Both fine and heraclitic,
Our instinct doubly softens:
Now, man forgets his shifting faces,
And with unseen toes,
Dips down in foggy waters.
Whether dawn or dusk, 
His half-dreamt dark does not betray,
And whether past or prologue
Remains untold until the day.

name: Origin
text:
Tripling worlds stretch back toward deep time
With careful rippling leaves, splayed
Into black and silent branches.
Orbic earth pulls in each direction,
Death-defying, yet barren,
Precarious in its watchful slumber;
Trees and sand creep upward,
Looming with a shaded hush,
Waiting for the noise to come.
Clouds in a softened glow
Prepare for the watchmen,
The observant and fleeting.
In the quiet of final moments,
A peaceful expectation grows;
A clean, abundant clarity:
The elegant, natural pose.

name: Aviso
text:
Beware lest your hearts become drowsy,
Nodding away in silent apathy,
Drowning without complaint.
Beware lest your souls become weary,
Floating away in bilious forms,
Wand’ring without restraint.

name: Animal
text:
A silence engendered by the tipsy fall of leaves, 
A silence buoyed by the tingling wind.
Such vertigo, such precariously primal focus
Peers just too far past the thinning edge -
Broken! 
Crack! 
Sun-sapped sticks
With a rush, now, with a snap.
Quick scuttle of quicker feet.
Look, 
Relax, 
Remember – 
Slowly and smoothly.
Move the frame to a subtler fix.
Fix your eyes and pray.

name: God
text:
I ask with a whisper,
Through a veil in the shadows.
There is wind – it feels cool.

Motions become slow,
Meandering as each bemused
Syllable waltzes with the moon.
There is light – it looks soft.

Long whistles, strung in tune
Sculpt this dream with memory.
Calm whimsy soothes the mind,
With a gentle, lulling sleep.

name: Porch
text:
Music slid by,
Softened in the rain,
Each drop suffused
With the levity of space
And the graying echoes of time -
They chisel slowly away, slowly away,
At the infinite blades of grass
Bowed in silent symphony.

name: Dusk
text:
Hanging loosely, my arms hover, sway,
Veins vining toward each fingertip,
Splaying a circular warmth
To soothe the quickened beat.
I remember the flickering yellow,
Fireflies swift in the humid dark,
Fated to be caught or lost by day.
I remember the sleeping sky,
Each moonrise warmer than the last,
Each dawn far off and heavy.
I remember your flaring nostrils
Open with each inhalation,
Blooming with the night.

name: Whitman
text:
Enter the bustling world, the trodden streets:
You say into the rush, the whirl, the craze!
Dare to defy the careening multitude
Overwhelmed by some quickening pace.
Let your shoes sidle to a standstill:
Out of step, out of time.
Nothing but breath.
But silence.  
Peace.

name: Remembrance
text:
Amidst the crush and hurry,
I give you a scene.
Bare back slumped
Against an oaken door,
Eyes half shut, mouth agape,
Mind awash on distant shores.

Within the boundary,
I give you a snap.
Pupils constrict, react,
With a focus upward peering:
Nothing but the Book, a cross,
Caught in the faded light.

To stir the air,
I leave you a breeze.
Skin bristles with that sudden chill,
Muscles tense, head tilted,
Locked for a look
Long and long at the lonely moon.

name: Extract
text:
Allow me to recollect for you a piece of your imagination:
Between the sinewy matters, dimmed and gray,
Through willowy foresights, lightly betrayed.
You see: your dormant mariner, your flightless bird
Rose darkly from the deepening sea.
Cold ridges cracked, split by the seams,
And spilt into various dreams.
Twilight encircled, vulturing down
Shrouding the hint, the rhythm above,
Though feathery stalks and mossy stones
Lingered to play with time.
Before the frail descent of words unheard,
A final stream slipped in view,
Soft light swimming in ripples.
Here, your mirror slowed beyond motion,
Steeped for a moment in silence,
Subdued in the stuff of perception.

name: Dual
text:
There is a chiseled hope
I see in the canyon:
Pink granite,
Hewn by the wind
And the rain.

There is a silent pain
I see now finely thinned:
A soul split,
Lone companion
Of a trope.

name: Lune
text:
Imagine the beauty:
The skipping of strings
Bounding to convey truth
From your deep abstraction.
Find the slow crescendo,
Tickling its sinuous way
Past your palms
Into wide-eyed wonder.
Softly bemused, now
Let the longer cadence
Smooth your twining sleep
With a distant, distant hush.

name: Ambler
text:
I could have begun with a purple hue,
Dipped in the nighttime luster – 
Though you may not have cared 
To see the color through.

I could have shown some shaded leaves
Strangely lit beneath the dusk,
Falling as silent droplets drop
To smooth the jagged earth.

I could have sung a midnight thrush
Tut, tut, oh-lay-oh-leeeee!
It’s liquid trill precise and clean,
It’s flutelike song so quickly hushed.

But I began with the bone-white path,
With steps of dust and shadow
Past sleeping limbs, now darkly green,
In a dappled moonlit glow.

name: Ash
text:
I swept my past into a pan.
Too long, I’d shuffled about,
Stirring clouds,
Stealing suns.
And now as I brushed
Past clicks of the clock,
I saw my story plain:
For man 
I swept.
you are dust
I swept.
And to dust you shall return.

name: Viginti
text:
Nineteen times had the bell struck three
Before I muttered quietly,
And for one tick more
Of the cyclic score
I clenched my hands and waited.
Yet as I knew
To be too true,
This ring I was not fated.

name: Cuatro
text:
Strum, pluck, strumming
Smoothly as cool water
Pools and pours forth
From a rounded gourd.
Pluck, strum, plucking
Quickly as warm droplets
Strike and swarm down
From a sudden cloud.
Toca, canta, tocando
Suavemente soñando hoy
El ritmo borinqueño,
El jíbaro del alma.

name: Wonder
text:
Mimic the flames’ flickering,
Carefully licking embers
Dipped in a fiery honey.
Count as the shifting splinters
Fracture brilliance from the sky.
Pretend to grasp the light.

name: Fragment
text:
Imagine, dream, where you began,
When seven cliffs of salted stone
Were all the secret ridges known,
As lavish tomes had rightly shown,
To you, the clueless thee.

name: Literal
text:
I once had a shaman show me
The mechanics that loose the mind.
She said to begin with symmetric
Variance of a slanted, peculiar kind.
Her final steps were simple rules
Forgotten now to verse and time.

I once had a showman awe me
With linguistics that nearly rhymed.
He said to begin with poetic
Variants of enchanted, shrewder lines.
His final words were wistful tools
For getting past a versed design.

name: Ego
text:
I crossed rivers in sudden bounds
Stopping still at lonesome views.
I took lessons from Jesus Christ
Lizards learning to leap on the water.
I smoked heaven from paper pipes
Curling wayward on your fickle secrets.
I fought against tectonic plates
Fracturing quicker with vertebrate zeal.

name: Impression
text:
To think, to swoon
In softer folds
Of the musical fabric,
Is to invoke Mozart,
To string quartets together
With a lifted loom
And listen.

name: Bullet
text:
Aloof. 
Your soul will wonder
If you’ll make this choice
As irrevocable as the past,
As necessary as the rain
And sleep that follows.

Aloud.
Fuck this
Introspection – 
It hounds
The tired centuries.

Alone.
It gives no pause 
To those who would linger,
And gives no pause
To those who will stray.

name: Conscience
text:
Careful with your devil deeds of daring.
Something lingers on the fringe – 
Head tilted, scanning the scene, skipping
To your false moves and rapid leaps
With a knowing apathy,
A resigned smile half as clear
As a curve 
Of air.

name: Secrets
text:
Picture the orb in its animal form - 
Raw, foaming, fighting to breathe.
With noxious touch, that spark ignites,
Wakens the clouds to heavens above,
Rips the seas to livelier motion.
Feel the quick moments burst
Forth in brilliant scales.
If you can feel the whisper,
If you can touch the waves,
Then gather your senses, convert
Knowledge into comprehension,
Silence into conversation.
Each relic of the pumice pummeled past
Waits timeworn and timid,
For you, sweet discovery.

name: Metamorphoses
text:
I’ve noticed thin lines,
Lines that curve into smiles,
Wrinkle into time
And break.

I’ve noticed thin lines,
Lines that mesh into poems,
Spiral into stairs
And fade.

I’ve noticed thin lines,
Lines that splay into forests,
Widen into plain

name: Pi
text:
Lay the towel low –
Kiss your forehead
To the cooled cloth
And draw a slow,
Deepening breath –
Let the delicacies of
Subtle asphyxiation
Ease your surrealism.
Move toward edges
Of hexagonal dreams,
Geometrically centric,
Wholly collapsable
And spherically shared.

name: Rapture
text:
Without a single thought of Kubla
Khan or the sound, illustrious Buddha,
I’ve sat at the edge of many rivers.

Some, I cannot recall without an
Insect buzz, a stinging ant.
Some, I cannot recall without
A longing that blurs
With the ease of eyes 
Falling blind.

In others still, I cannot recall myself –
I grow wild in observation
Struck by the spirit,
Soul soaked in
Kerosene,
And lit.

name: Dissipate
text:
I’ve watched my feet follow dirt
That snaked thru tall grasses and
Strolled into streams of shade.
Soothed by the current and 
Cooled by the wind,
I was a fervent immortal
Whispering to leopards
Lost in discussions
Of the old parody.
A gambler’s duplicate die,
A lone hourglassed dune,
A saint’s faded halo:
These were my visions in youth.
Each world could halt.
In my heart, each breath
Could vaporize as waters 
Crash for the sake of the moon.

name: Return
text:
Remember the rising dawn,
Each hazy slumber filled blink
Waking you to dreams of another dreamer,
To a warm and slow embrace.

Remember the wand’ring day,
The paths meandering, the ocean drifting,
As you smiled with summer’s sun
And laughed with peaceful eyes.

Remember the fading night,
So smooth and softly hushed,
As your lips momently hovered,
Whispering love with a kiss.

name: Race
text:
Your time. Your pace. Your gaze.
Drop them as nothing,
Shed and shred ‘em
By the shoulder side scraps
Of your highwayed mind.
Go ahead.
Pave another speedway
With a speed lane
And a wasp name.

So how goes the dream?
Stronger than ever
With the right kind of means

Now take a step back
And release each thought
Quicker than these quicker shots,
Straight off a gun cocked top,
From the trigger of a cop, stop, STOP!!!
Ten times more for broken bodies
And a lifeless beat.

So how goes the dream?
Stranger than never
With the white minded fiends.

name: Pixy
text:
When I lost my mind to the dandelioned fields,
I felt a certain ease.
I sliced each linen that
Follows the sinusoidal shell;
Mirrored rocks with recursive fades
Shine as fabled canyons shine
In a scarlet streaking sky;
Electric timbers in the morning
Are attenuated antennae
Twitching with the pulse of the sun;
Bridges lost to time or the door
Find solace in an eye’s embrace.

name: How
text:
I lack the conviction of a priest or a beggar.
I count time with the passing wind.
I shift my feet on the standstill earth.
I swim.
I pray.
Again.

name: Movement
text:
Run along with the river
With its vibrant shakes
Of winding waters.
I may see you there,
Banked by the wall,
Resting with stone,
Wrestling with time.
One wave drops
And the other follows.
I will sit in the sun again.

name: Source
text:
There is more than soil
In the sudden swirl,
There is more than stone
In the sudden rush.
Gifts are given
From the shattered soul,
From the tattered cloud.
No two tries can play
The same tune,
And what repetition 
Lacks, rhythm fills.

name: Abuelo
text:
Between the points of needled light
With a yarn of strung out clouds,
I spin for you the sky soaked moss
And weave these darkened leaves.
I tread upon the softer limbs,
Hanging in the balance:
Above my eyes a branching web,
I spiral close and limber.
Treetop reaching, heaven wishing,
I breathe for you the pinewood air,
I feel the lightened breeze.

name: Shakey
text:
Rock splits to gravel to dust
And kicks away step by step,
Blows away wind-wise.
Can’t be seen much,
Can’t be felt much,
But each banjo strum
Brings it all a little closer.
Back together.
Texas heat cracks barn
Doors with paint lines
That branch, break and fold.
They’ve gotten sharper now,
So tend to the dry brush -
Cool the waterless air
With straw hat shadows,
And lacquer the oakwood boards.
Then wait and drop back.
Watch blazing hours give way
To a fire-glazed dusk.

name: Turnout
text:
Like little Italian coves/
Finding ways to tame the sea/

name: Vengeance on the Bottle
text:
The nighttime street sounds off -/
Beats borne from plastic buckets/
Escape the muni stairs/
Lit and loud./

This isn’t Langston’s/
Drowsy syncopated tune./
It belongs to someone else,/
Someone tilted, jaunty, rumbling down./
It’s a mixed noise:/
Unhurried, frantic noise/
That baselines a chorus/
Of weed whispers, vomit and sewer steam,/
Locked arms, needle pricks/
And a couple of laughs./

Sometimes the streets can feel this way,/
Fill you up this way/
With reluctant pride./
The city’s alive./
The city kills./

name: Sutro
text:
Windlash, whiplash leading down the folds/
The turns, the mountain slope/
Ending here:/
A burned and blackened crescent trunk/
Five feet tall in mossy ruin/
A nicely built wooden deck/
Stuck beneath a sandstone skull/
Cavernous eyes, a hollow nose/
Looming tilted and mouth empty,/
Gut-hungry and pitiful./
I have felt this thin before/
And am thinner still than I know./
My stillness will last a handful of seconds,/
My thinness a handful of years./
The skull already knows this/
And cannot forget./
It stares down./
I turn around,/
Walk back to face the wind./

name: Cozy
text:
Buzzed, rosy cheeks, full heart, chuckles/
and smiles/
Warmth, love and a comfy couch, lazily/
Splayed, falling deeply together to sleep/

name: Again
text: Death runs in the family…/

name: Confession
text: Forgive me, Father, I know exactly what I do/

name: Grandpa
text:
These books were made of leather/
Hand heavy with trimmings/
Brushed in gold./
We opened the fronts - a thin few pages/
At a time./
We opened the backs the same/
Then front, then back -/
A reverent process/
Midward creasing./
We learned that the binding/
Breathed this way -/
Shivered and settled into new life./
Old and ancient words/
Popping up/
For fresh delights./

name: Funeral
text: Love is the only word that comforts death./

name: Nighttime Rain
text:
Bleary, dreary, weathered and weary/
Is it any surprise/
It’s all so eerie?/

name: Adagio
text: Family will warm and strengthen you/

name: Ad Homonym
text:
Cool degrees, sharp degrees,/
Wet degrees/

name: Therapeutics
text: Self-medicated musical sedative/

name: Nouny
text:
I think of caterpillar skies/
Dandelion lies/
Rapacious raptors/
Crocodile thunder/
-M./

name: Arches
text:
I’ve found ghosts in cities/
Empty arches/
Strong and double-blind -/
Neither side seeking./
They’ve watched/
Only for the soled passers/
Posed only/
For the souled captors/
Historical nonsense notwithstanding/
May their bricks and bones/
Be everlasting./

name: Huddle
text:
We walk down some twilit lanes/
Postured against/
The bayward wind/

name: Maybe
text:
Lethargy and camaraderie/
Can make a strong recompense/
For misery./

name: Trilogic Tryptych
text:
Three, three, three…/
Always the third/
Unheralded word./

name: Swingtime
text:
We danced/
And I swear it was another room/
They sang so loud, so clear/
I could feel them here -/

No we were there/
We danced./
And I know they crooned/
Their beauty/
Just for us./

name: Resigned
text:
A broken day of angry code/
I put my heartfelt depth aside/
Did not see your love./

name: Us
text: This is heaven./

name: Inaguration
text:
Shaken down with lofty lies/
The people cheer their swindler./

name: Manual
text:
Off and on/
Rainy walking…/
Respect these streets/
And the hands that built them./
They’ll wither with/
Each clunky step/
And often need rebuilding./

name: America Is A Flag
text:
This flag moves/
With a violence/
The ocean doesn’t feel./
Ripped side to side,/
The stripes gnash and snap./
They lash to pride/
Fold to steel/
Fly with my nation’s/
Jealous zeal./

name: Pathless
text:
Yesterday’s light/
Lit my sinew./
Tensed me to/
Tightly wound/
Greyhound/
Migration./
Pushed my thick/
Bones/
To cold/
Warbound/
Sick vibrations./
I missed/
A home in the park/
Chucked stones/
In the dark/
Waited for sweet/
Sweet/
Handheld redemption./

name: Planned Delight
text:
A walk in the rain./
Citrus rind blossoms/
Line the graveled edges./

name: Nestldown
text:
Redwood cathedral/
In a mystic rain/

name: Code Refusal
text: It’s unnatural how natural this keyboard is./

name: Tapestry
text:
The spangled banner/
Shook its stars loose/
Dropped them in/
Some concrete rubble/
Behind the Civic Center Hotel./

It kept some stripes/
Plastered to the wall:/
Shaky red streaks/
Peeling in gunshot splotches.

name: Nonsense I
text:
Musical scores/
Rip into homes/
With tripartite/
Strums./
Another mechanical rhythm./

name: Don’t Look Too Close
text: Confusion locks delusion/

name: Panhandle
text:
Pray for those/
Who find a path/
To everywhere/
But home./

Pray for those/
Who camp each night/
By the litter/
Refusing to quit,/
Existence refuted/
By every pair/
Of shudders shrugged./

Every closed wallet/
Holding only plastic/
And not a damn dime./

name: Tense
text: Read, read, re-read/

name: Roots
text:
Identify these/
Channeled youth/
As the base/
Of a bastardized movement./

name: Premonitions
text:
Literature can answer/
The prayers of politics/
And paint/
Its future threats./

name: Copy Machine
text:
Hunger as a spiritual construct/
As a lyrical concept/
It feels played out…/

name: Lone Star
text:
They declared independence/
Gained the freedom/
To bound their own lands/
To draw lines/
Where before there had/
Been rivers or canyons/
Or swaths of sand./

name: Dogpatch
text:
There’s just as much gravel here/
Wide crumbling parkways/
Rollaway garage doors/
Painted numbers…/
I know it’s all the same/
West coast, no coast./
Practicality is common practice./
Form is function./
Art is confused./

name: Streetwise Horticulture
text:
Today I learned/
How a window blooms./
I watched it burst/
In a loud collapse/
Scatter on impact with a resting curb./

A thousand and one/
Cube-cut shards -/
Safety glass pioneered/
To show its true translucent blue./

Another cache of mineral pools/
To dot the pavement./

Busted down/
From a solid state,/
Vacant pane/
Where a window grew./

name: Spectators
text:
Is it too calm?/
Is this a fraud?/
A gentrified wilderness/
Retreat./

Danger disappeared at least/
A hundred thousand/
Moons ago./

Now it’s just soft fruit/
For a nagging chorus of flies -/
Warnings not to stray/
From these chosen/
Compacted trails/
Cause if you do/
You might get…itchy?/

Poison oak is a devil/
If you can’t quite find/
The right lotion…/

Brambly thorns might/
Catch and nick you!…/

Is that what we become?/
No respect and trickled fear./
The rapids long lost,/
Understanding faded./

We only muse it now,/
We gauge its decorations./

name: Bottomed Out
text:
Does oblivion obliviate?/
Or is it the passive end/
To an active depth?/
A decay vacuumed/
Painfully clean./

name: Lazy Chase
text:
I walked Sutro alone/
Felt the wet mud/
And rustling creatures/
Hurry my walk/
Into sputtering jogs./

Go farther and farther uphill/
Gain the high ground/
Lose the worry/
Or some shit like that./

name: Crook
text:
Toenail moon/
Hanging around the/
Late afternoon/
You’d be/
Better off/
Clipped./

name: Immanence
text:
How people take a heavy foot/
Lift it and move it forward/
Day by step by step by day/
How people progress/
Without love/
To carry the burden/
I do not know./

name: Zuni Street Band
text:
He thought he was a captain/
Saw the bay stretch wide/
Behind him./
Saw the water narrow/
Up ahead./

A hundred million/
Tons of steel -/
Jam-packed into/
Rattled boxes./

You see, he thought he was
A captain:/
Ghost crew/
Long gone from the deck./

He thought he was a captain/
Asleep in the hull,/
Cargo drifting/
Into certain conclusions./

You see, Rick -/
He thought he was a captain.

But he plays the damn/
Guitar/
With a stomping/
Barefoot beat./

He sings that Ozzie/
Ozbourne/
With a fire/
Buried deep./

His rails are set./
His engine’s spitting steam/
This train is free/
And he’s the deft/
Conductor./

name: 6th & Market
text:
It rains here too./
At least I heard it does./
Heard the noise/
It dampens./

I’ve also heard/
The noise it spurs./
Mad honks,/
Wet-lashed umbrellas,/
And laughs of lovers/
Caught without one./

I’ve seen the people too./
Some get caught off guard -/
They usually hurry through./
Some get caught on guard,/
And they hurry too -/
Barely make it/
To stationary sedan doors./

Some can’t get caught./
They huddle in the same spots./
Grit their teeth and hope it stops./

name: Golden Hour
text:
Hey I think I found/
Something/
In that backyard/
By the empty lot./

I don’t wanna move it./
I just wanna snap it,/
Immortalize and drop it/
In a square frame/
Til the Internet fades./

Make it look like beauty/
Lives in the struggle./

Forget
The barbed wire hooks/
The beaten shoe husks/
The urine stench/
The compact syringes/
The makeshift tent/
The sidewalk shit smears./

Cause it’s 5:45 on a Tuesday/
And those dusk-lit vines/
Hide the most stunning rose./

name: What’s At Stake
text:
Tell a tourist/
Where the tourists go./
Show a friend/
Where the locals go./
As if you think you know/
Or know you know./

Ballcaps and chatty voices/
Be damned./
Photos never last as/
Long as you want./
But memories.

They leave exactly/
When they’re/
Supposed to./

name: White Lies
text:
I saw SF from a rooftop/
Or a hill or an island./
It was the sunrise once/
But more often the sunset./
Sometimes it was the nighttime./
And each time/
It was the light/
That burnt or broke/
The image./

San Francisco is a melodic mirage/
(2:17 PM on a September Sunday)/
San Francisco is a foggy basin/
San Francisco is colder than its homes care to admit/

San Francisco is just as cold/
As its homeless admit./
(5 AM of almost every morning)./

name: Staggering
text:
I’m as close to the hunt/
As I’ll ever choose to feel./
I carry a thrilled focus/
In the space behind my eyes,/
A heart beats me/
Into the chase./

Light falls faster/
Than my footsteps/
Fly./

My eyes cannot reach them all./
And the birds/
Are already heading home./

name: National Amnesia
text:
You must’ve heard about the rally -/
Down on Market?/
Scientists marched for science./
They joined the crowds/
Of causes so long gone/
They’ve come all the way/
Back up again./

It’s a troubled phrase./
A cheap way to issue/
Forth a mythic/
Formulaic/
Pendulum./
It’s a cop out./

We didn’t account/
For friction./
We didn’t remember/
The gears grow old./
We never wait long enough to see/
Heat and rust/
Squeak it down into/
Perpendicular stillness./

We got distracted/
And now the bob’s awry/
We say nature took its course!/
Didn’t even notice/
Someone gave the weight/
A violent shove/

name: Languid
text:
I love how the daytime/
Hits three o’ clock/
Starts to quit its/
Hard fought peak/
And tell us all/
To start winding down./

name: Tigers
text: Blue is a relentless color./

name: Sand Dune City
text:
It lacks a river/
Doesn’t feel the need/
To build bridges/
The desire to know/
What it’s like on the other side/
The city cannot or will not/
Move in desert spaces/
Does not properly value life/
In its most resilient forms/
Abundance crowds out/
And chokes down/
The prime dwellers but/
Only for a while/
The river doesn’t swell/
In constant measure/
Or in linear prediction/
It will return/

name: Habitual
text:
There are people here now/
Beating on the door to get some work/
There are weeds are/
Spikier than nightmare/
Spinach that would leave/
You with a gut/
More busted up/
Than Popeye’s broken face/
There are people on the stoop/
They’ve had their fill/
Of venom greens/
Been reduced by them/
Curled up cold with an ache/
To disappear/

name: Power
text:
In cypress trees/
Even raptors kick/
Down the dead branches/

name: Gone
text:
Sometimes fog/
Follows boats down the/
Straight path/
Hulls rumbling beneath/
The Golden Gate/
I’ve seen the bridge/
Get wrapped up in this/
Smoke/
I’ve felt taller/
Than its twin peaks/
Gazing from the top of a/
Hill’s/
Top of a tree./
People picnic in the/
Half shade below me/
Hummingbirds hover/
A woodpecker counts down/
The erratic last seconds/
Before its next meal./

name: Observation No. 1
text:
History and proper suggestion/
Set a table in the middle/
Of your room/

name: Lonesome
text:
Stoned in the back of/
A barroom/
Bricks broken barely able/
To spell./

I left my bike/
Bone-locked/
On the streetside/
Checked on it from the window/
Strolled up and out/
Of the corner/

I was numb./
And there was a lot of noise/
Felt like bamboos/
Like baboon’s booze/

I couldn’t tell you/
I couldn’t yell to you/
That some corners/
Aren’t meant to/
Be left./

name: Tidy
text:
Landscapes like this one/
Are so damn defined./
Block-bound planes play/
Down/
The frantic lives of ivy/
Sprigs./
Square plots, fair plots/
And the neighbor’s/
Gravel trapezoids/
Give strange birth/
To trees propped up/
By the ribs of their/
Siblings./

I get it./
I mean…/
I kinda see that I’m the same./
But I’m not so sure/
That the others know./
Not so sure/
They understand/
The forest already got killed/
For the trees./

name: Cynic
text:
I don’t know that/
This goblet/
Or that one,/
To be matter of fact,/
Holds anything too unique./
What’s waste is wasted/
What’s cool is fresh/
And what decays/
Smells a thousand/
Gangrened orange peels/
In a basket/
Or a bin./

name: Inheritance
text:
Borges developed/
A wild intuition/
Felt the essential/
Repetition of things,/
Yet persevered./
He was well versed/
In Ptolemaic archetypes/
Saw that yesterday’s/
Beggardly streets/
Were also Rome’s/
Were also God’s/
Were also his./

name: Perceptibly Impersonal
text:
Bring it down into the page/
That one’s iPhone/
Wheels mechanics/
Wrought by far more genius/
Than we can pretend/
To pretend to fathom./

His face is lit/
But damn if it isn’t/
A cold glow./
Don’t you wish/
They could’ve spilled some/
Warmth on the glass?/
Don’t you/
Hope you won’t/
Have to stare, neck down,/
For too many more/
Years?/
At least in the bar,/
Some people pretend./

name: Placard Sense
text:
Trees are not poems/
And are not designed/
To be the deaths/
We so long for them to be./

Trees get struck down/
By the sky/
Get split up by the sky,/
Struggle in its chest/
And grimace/
With its deeper inhalations./

A tree is a mangled,/
Pock-marked truth/
That managed its way/
With genetics and luck/
To be the flat frame/
That you don’t understand./

Spend a minute, an hour/
A sunset/
In its sturdy arms./

Then speak to me of/
The poetic earth/
That draws upon the sky./

name: Welcome to the Machine
text:
Green love coded the spectrum/
We like to consider./
Ran its shades/
From r-hex to g to b./
Made displays fill/
The electronic screen/
Quicker than blinks/
Softer than love./
But more visceral,/
But less real./
You can’t imagine square/
Tiled roofstops/
Until you’ve seen them/
In this illumination./
Ninety degrees never/
Looked so good - /
Nested in parallax,/
Rounded in wallpaper/
Decorations./
You couldn’t have held/
Onto that - /
Even if you wanted./

name: Gentrified
text:
I ordered an Old Cuban/
In the whitest of towns./
Sure,/
It’s progressive./
Sure,/
You can smoke weed every second/
On a sidewalk/
That leads straight to/
Banks and the bay./

But try some time to/
Speak as you’re supposed to/
Lips set in Spanish tones./
Greet the blank but smiling/
Faces./
And remember they don’t give/
A fuck either./
They’ll wash you away/
With a wave/
And a couple of nods./

name: Privilege
text:
Knowledge wills its way/
Into your every day/
Expertise assumed with/
Some quietude and a/
Couple spare nods./

name: Insulated
text:
A thousand valves per/
Square inch of your personal/
Purview, dug in/
Flutelike depth to the/
Midnight terrain./
From a hundred feet you/
Miss the immense familiarity./

From ten thousand up,/
The yellow-white, blue-red/
Lamplights hypnotize/
In a nautical theme./

They float in siloed unison/
As bioluminescent snapshots./
They disappear with the/
Inescapable curvatures/
Of horizons and shores./

These vivid tattoos/
Call/
With a pointillist forebearance/
Shattered into/
A pointed vigilance./

It braces/
Against/
The hidden forest,/
The farm/
And undefined spaces./

name: Craftsmanship
text:
Stitch and staple - /
Sinusoidal leather boats/
With a dip of gloss,/
A wedge cut,/
And a hand-written,/
Tech-delivered/
Price tag./
Retro fits/
Never felt so rich(e)./

name: Uniform Variance
text:
It was ticklish/
And it was pervasive/
I doubt I could’ve/
Picked myself/
Out of that crowd/

Even the tropical/
Flavors played along,/
Faded themselves/
As a favor/
To blend/
With this muted vanity./

Blue is black is gray is blue./

Not the ceiling’s/
Fanning wooden ridges/
Not the framed moments/
Of accidental (“artistic”)/
Explosions/

Nothing gave much of a mutiny./
We mostly complied./
Ate a slice or two of bread../

name: Urgent: Questionnaire
text:
Could you tell me how many birds/
You saw from the ground?/
You saw in a dream?/
You saw? You see?/

Bare your teeth,/
Your barren teeth./

Could you tell me/
How many dreams/
You saw in a bird?/

How many?/

Could you keep them?/
Have you flown/
Just to fly?/
Have you jumped/
From the redwood trees?/
Tell me how many/
Dreams you need to know./

name: Category 5
text:
We’ve protected hunger,/
Begged with thirst,/
And failed the banks./

We have more life/
In walled off street ends/
Than your pillared shells./

We tie flags/
To tentpole doorsteps/
Shanty and shorn./

We line the sidewalks,/
Barricade against the red and blue/
Bluster./

When we break/
We stand up in our wake/
We get ready to build,/
Dispersed,/
But never dispossessed./

name: Bubble Talk
text:
If you can eat a balanced/
Diet of politicized news,/
You are not dispossessed./

If you can’t move within/
The syntax of cities/
You’ll be surprised/
Where the wind bites./

name: Regret
text: I left the summer in Texas/

name: City of Cold Shoulders
text:
Why does everyone look/
So damn the same?/
Why is all this decay/
So damn contrived?/

I don’t wanna be mixed up/
In this kind of a/
Cold mess./

Half the day/
Satellites keep warmer company/
Than San Francisco./

name: Ordinary
text:
I stared in a window/
At dusk./
The help, the cook,/
The cleaning crew/
Walked around/
In a Miyazaki light./
It wasn’t surreal/
But it should’ve been./
It was a yellow lit/
Pane,/
Angled with the right/
Dimensions…/
But the trays were/
Striped, but their/
Arms were striped/
Painted by the blinds,/
Dressed beneath/
The nines/
No more opaque/
Than your shadow./

name: Lisboa
text:
Angled walls were made/
To mitigate/
This hilltop curve,/
To retain a/
Modern language./
Spanish-tiled roofs were made/
To preserve tradition/
With a patchwork flow./

Hammers echo/
In the corridors/
Between these cobbled/
Structures./
Police sirens trace/
Audible paths/
In their canyons./

The river-ocean/
Stretches a bit beyond,/
A slow-changing, massive backdrop/
Mostly to be viewed/
From up close/
Or up above./
The wind’s push is strong, but periodic./

A couple hammers/
Still carroom./

name: Observatory
text:
The urban forest lives/
Only at a distance/
Great enough to light/
Imagination./
Approaching this boundary,/
Even tall leaves/
Hide behind alley walls/
Of steeled stone./
From within,/
The trees disperse/
In ordered clumps and/
Garden rows./
They pose next to/
Latin placard notes/
Because we are forgetful,/
Or scientific,/
Or both./

name: Porto
text:
A blanket mutes/
Parts of the hillside/
Patterned in dark/
Green spades,/
Sprinkled with purple/
Morning glory blooms./

Leaning down to/
The river, shadows/
Dealt cool passages./

Once homes, now ruins/
Lay beneath./

The stubborn base of/
A chimney rises/
To a covered dome./

One roof nearby/
Staves off the ivy mass./
Its rusted and ribbed/
Steel sheets/
Are carefully layered./

It’s getting past dusk/
And no one inside/
Has turned on a light./

name: Train Landscape
text:
Do you know/
How to know/
When the soil shifts?/
Do you see the bark/
Spacing out?/
Do you see the treetops/
Rounding?/
Then shrinking?/
Alpine to flatline/
Crisp to endless./

name: Les Beaux
text:
Enormous stone tomb/
Punched into the mountainside/
Clean cut cavern/
With triangular shadows/

name: Praia da Rocha
text:
The ocean is a sculptor/
With a blue-green fade/
And a sandstone habit./

name: Lagos
text:
The ocean is as peaceful/
As the wind that drives it/
And sand is as fine/
As the ocean grinds it/

name: Ellison
text:
Many somewheres below/
Cables serve your/
Electric feast./
Rocking chair blues/
With a side/
Of socialite scrolling./
Flameless nighttimes/
Mothed in a MOMA glow/

Ten miles away/
Capacitors stand/
Like military grade/
Memorial tombstones/
Ground-rooted and gridded./

Somewhere beyond/
The sun drops notes/
In pastel/

Blurred by waved mirages/
Cooling towers/
And a pilot light./

name: Lisbon Cathedral
text:
Stonebare cathedral/
Carried a chorus/
Borne/
Of magnificent depth./

name: Life Is Not Mathematics
text:
Roll with it/
The details can’t/
Be proven -/
Regardless of how/
You think/
Or why you think./
You’ll only ever get to/
Know a handful/
Or a couple/
Of specks./

Time can be cheated./
But only for so long./

name: Embarrassed
text:
Exhaustion shuts eyelids/
Slower than shame./

name: Gut Empty
text: Anger and all that vacates with it./

name: Graph Theory
text:
To be yarn-strung/
Together/
Looped through our sleeves/
In a thin way./
To be railcar/
And subway commuters./
This is how the Valley/
Connects./

Not much crosstalk./
A few cliques./
Apple or Google at hand./

Some new authority/
Manning the loudspeaker/
Giving the same directions/
From time to time./

name: Prompt Paralytics
text:
People march here/
Far before their orders are ready./

name: Codebase
text:
- Creation is an ongoing process with/
	Tender tendrils farther reaching/
- Definitions are only as exact as your/
	Computer fails to understand/
- Customer-facing, machine-facing/
	Worldwide-blindness-making/
- There are notes in this view/
	That cannot be true/

name: Lazy Code
text:
Haphazard nesting/
Keeps the wheels turning./

name: Track Marks
text:
Strange to think/
How these trains have wheels/
That never leave/
Their grooves - /
How these trains carry/
People/
Who never left careers./
For fear of crashed/
Derailure/
They grind and grind away./

name: Grafitti
text: Filthy fowl on the fringe./

name: Rodin
text:
He sat there statuesque,/
Like the Thinker,/
Head drooped a little lower,/
Wrist pushed up/
Against the ear./

He sat there stuck,/
Needle hanging deep/
From a forearm vein/
Thin lines of blood/
Leaking/
Past old tattoos./

name: Fictional Estate
text:
We sat on the other side/
Of the chain-link fence./
And got used to sitting there./
Next to the weeds,/
Fog residue facing/
From the hillside top./
We felt big enough/
To fill that clearing/
Spry enough to balance/
Beam our way across/
These old foundations./
We traced the outlines/
Of a home here./
We broke the thicket/
Of walls, windows and doors./
We knew how young had to be./
The daylight couldn’t have been/
Much older./

name: Fraudulent Opulence
text:
Give me your tongue/
Scrolling from your mouth./
Give me your words./

I’m not here to scoop them up,
Splattered./

I will not spike and prod/
With forceps,/
Poking tonsils,/
Plucking into your throat./

I need to find them./
Feed me your source./
I hunger before I thirst./

Liquor lacquered eyes/
Look through me/
Pitter patter steps/
Peek past me./

I will be invisible/
Where you need me to hide./
I will listen/
I long/
To hear you slang./

name: Slow-Volt Spine I
text:
Slow-volt spine/
Vertebrae measured in mileage./

name: Transactional Mercy
text:
Minimalist and fresh/
Open and vacant,/
Each meeting is a product/
Unto itself/
A proper experience with/
Proper engagement./
Mind the details./
There is an ordered set/
Of implications/
We will enumerate, rank/
And defuse./
We choose this because/
There are encoded measures/
Of procession./
Part ritual, part escape,/
We forsake Malcolm and Theresa/
Opt into a staged setup/
Devoid of risky/
Interactions./

name: Discombobulate
text:
Daylight moves its death/
Into three tunnels./
Two fix noise/
Into whirring types of/
Respiration./
The third leaves noise/
To listen to itself./
Every morning I awake/
In one of these caves,/
Lace up my shoes/
And stumble out./

name: Not Everything
text:
When you stop at each stop,/
You see less./
You think too much/
In exasperation./

Finding that new/
Or cold/
Benches/
Get neglected the same/
After 8pm/
Isn’t a pattern./

name: Marriage
text:
Re-appear with me/
In bountiful flashbacks/
We married young, my love./
We’ll walk to grow redwood/
Strong, turtle-wise./
Smooth as riverstone/
Shaped by years/
We’ll run to grow old./
We’ll sleep in meadow grasses/
Pray in humble coves./
But now, we sit uplifted,/
Exchanging love/
In glances, vows and gazes./
Heart to hand/
To hand to heart,/
Two souls, one life./

name: Observation No. 2
text:
Honeycombs are proxies/
For offset rows/
Of slanted circles../

name: Sunbathing
text:
Sunspots bruise my inner eyelids/
Squinting shut/
In stop-motion Doppler scans./

name: Streetchair
text:
Nada pasa nunca/
En la calle/
Hay que sentarse y esperar/
Los viejitos no dicen casi nada/
A veces le pagan treinta/
O cuarenta/
El hombre con la voz/
De piedra pulverizada/
Se congregan por la noche/
A beber, a sonreír/
Y mirar hasta el fondo/
De la calle./

name: Found Musician
text:
Brother Thelonius/
Part time friend, full time friar/
And patron saint of Bottled Bebop TM/
You give a frigid night/
Its needed warmth/
Bubbled in a brooding brew:/
Jazz life imbibed./

Best absorbed on the sidewalk/
Lifeline, sweet record/
Slow-spinning inside,/
A faint recall -/
That deft, adept set of hands/
Playing the melodies that move them/
Keyboard spun into a halo/
Mindful crowd soaking it in./

name: Foundational
text:
Identify these/
Channeled youth/
As the base/
Of a bastardized movement./

Literature can answer/
The prayers of politics/
And paint/
Its future threats./

Hunger as a spiritual construct/
As a lyrical concept/
It feels played out . . ./
They declared independence/
Gained the freedom/
To bound their own lands/
To draw lines/
Where before there had/
Been rivers or canyons/
Or swaths of sand./

name: Coin-op Frenzy
text:
Smooth minted coins!/
Fresh, smoothly minted coins!!/
To be captured by your captor’s/
Computational fancy!/
The blockchain must be complete/
Will be validly verified/
Suitably certified/
And dutifully returned to circulation./

name: Excessive
text: Lights spillover in tree branch canyon fashion/

name: Help
text:
I am the slow-volt spine/
Vertebrae spliced from bark/
Beer-drunk and thrashing/
In close spurts./
I think your wheels revolve/
In animatronic fashion/
Linguistic blandness sprays./
The neural centers in our skulls/
Break these down/
When they need to quit./
Toss fitfully into random bags./
I cannot find them./
Where did I/
When did I/
Lose my shocking mind?/
Baseballs or their aviary shadows/
Blow by./
Vegetation, hilltopping stagnation/
Are hermits/
In my book-bred brainspace./
Reluctant delinquents in productive/
Progressions./
I stress to stress for you/
How linguilicisms/
Create careful comforts/
Out of base determinations./
I am lost with your grave debilitations./
My father moved knowingly (slowly)/
In casket situations./
My mother moved briskly/
(Broke)/
In slow-moving iterations./
You want them both./
My brothers aim to recycle/
Wash-down iterations./
Get bizarre/
From 17 feet away/
There are treetops taller/
Than planetips and planets./
Sunsets higher than crowds./
Do not fucking park your wheel./
Do not brake your goddamn wheel./
Sprint close/
Breather closer./

name: Incomplete
text:
Reclamation is a passionless drum/
That beats from the west./
A persistent baritone foamy mess./
It leaves its brother/
To mind the inland clearing./
Collapse. Dissolve. Reclaim./
Decay lies dormant/
In every front yard, every pot,/
Each gap in the pavement’s grid./
It thrives in the bayshore boglands/
And rusty dogpatch husks./
It moves all along the railroad edge./

name: Elegy
text:
Reclaim me!/
Drag me out by the cuff!/
I’ll be your Irish, your Hispanic/
Your new wave white!/
I’ll be what belongs./
I know how you push./
I’ve seen how you pull./
I want to blend/
Into your background/
Like Ellison’s nameless man./

name: Currency
text:
When you are told you have nothing to say/
You listen/
And you do so with a pencil/
You cram voices/
Into your pockets,/
Mark tones onto your pages/
Even the faint ones/
Exchange them for cash/
After a bit of transcription./

name: Wavering Belief
text:
I’ve been to the edge/
Where you claim deliverance/
Clutched your forearms/
In a gripping wave./
But I know now this ocean is a poor redeemer./
It must’ve thrashed you into silence (prayer)/
The way it dragged me/
So far down/
I could only beg./

name: Demand No. 1
text: Let me float./

name: Abstract Dexterity
text:
I dropped wisely/
Into the scaffolding - slats/
Where my mental lap/
Shivered into position./
I was not noted,/
Not Concrete, not versioned/
Nor versed./
I was masked and imagined,/
As Daedalus or sleep./

name: Abridged
text:
Run quickly from the wasteland woods/
When clouds darken to rain/
The air will disappoint you/
The ground will lie, well/
Lessoned in alchymy’s failures/
Slab-splashed and dense./

I do not want you to shiver/
There, iron-propped,/
Cold contained./
I beg you./
Fly quickly when the treetops/
Disappear./

name: Eponymous
text:
Footstep stops stepping foot/
On the pavement square,/
Rip-flows outward where/
Corners meet roots/
Where sky glass shakes/
Thinly sunlit and beautiful./

Vines lace and stitch themselves/
To prominence/
On the bank-drawn backbones/
Of monied behemoths./

(The radial spread/
forebade the vertical move)/

Reborne,/
Their timely growth/
Sheds concrete crumbs -/
A handful a day:/
Voracious, ambitious, clean./

name: Bound
text:
Giant of the suburbs/
Redwood tower fortified/
And flanking the crosswalk/
You stand corralled and cordoned off/
By short-fenced lining/
A net of flies frenzied/
At your base/
Picks and mines the manicure/
Wealth of decay/.

Brown thatcher to bark/
To dizzy branches/
Spindling deepest green/
In the isolate canopy./

I would stay a while/
But a neon green has/
Forced my eye again/
Some corner of the mind convinced/
It’s time to move along./

name: 6th
text:
When these hotel rooms/
Are your home,/
The sidewalks become/
Your porch./
The stalled cars vibrating (humming)/
In late September summer heat/
Become a mess of dogs/
Urinating sweat and gasoline/
Onto your lawn/
When they sit, you/
Shuffle noisily past the muzzled (the muffled) lot,/
Go greet your neighbors/
Lounging on the other side. The shade side./
There hasn’t been a swelter/
Like this in God knows/
How long/
Sealed hydrants tease/
Refreshment overflowing/
Gossip passes the afternoon/

name: The Valley
text:
Part isthmus, part wellspring/
I cannot stress/
To stress for you enough/
How the world shakes/
When we move/
How it finds itself anew/
Looks bewildered at its open palms/
Shocked by what they wrought/
Stunned by what they can now wreak./

name: Keep It Racing
text:
Head nod swinging/
Bouncing to shoe heel/
Beat-keeping tap-downs/
On cold-cut stone./
Tambourines should’ve been/
Built to this rhythm/
Racing, shaking/
Balanced on the Beach./

name: Anthracitic
text:
I move the slow-volt spine,/
Snake its rattled bones/
With gentle whiplash/
I heave its bodied skull/
To and fro/

name: Fundamental
text:
Nothing persuades/
More than presence/
Nothing breaks a premise/
More than promise/

name: Loosened
text:
I know I’ve caught a rare remark/
When she giggles, little bit of gums showing-/
Eyes squinting soft,/

Or when she stares,/
Relentless/
Heart blazed in disbelief/

I seek these moments/
With an equal but opposite passion/
I flurry, word wise and wonderful/
I parry, ashamed./

name: Subtlety
text:
It sounded like the pressure popped/
Clocked your inner ears/
In a wind you’d find/
On the hanging side of a ferry/
Body tilted, clutching the rails/
Bones paralytic./

name: Pivotal Mantras
text:
I change the way: to build, to break/
To mold a cold culture into one/
Brimming with cause/
Shifted focus, adapt what you’ve learned/
Create a compassionate economics/
Invest in minds, livelihoods/
There is a common cause, heartfelt/
And universal, to set loose, set free/
This is an emphatic formulation,/
Empathetic formation/

name: Last Day
text:
romance is lost without absence/
a sheltered pair lounges in the car/
listens to fifties crooners sing the heavens/
as heavy blue tails slather tri-color soap/
from sunroof to wheel rims/
they smile to know no wandering eyes/
can pierce this foamy shell/
they lie in mechanic respiration/

name: Lance Armstrong
text:
“That’s a good question…”/
What did you feel compelled to answer?/
The truth? Did shame spur you? Did truth spurn you?/
Had you deconstructed your flimsy self?/
Did you ponder praise? Secretly pray/
For misinterpretation? For reinvigoration?/
I heard you trail off/
Next breath building sharply in lungs ballooned/
Heartbeat both stopped and pounding/
Brain barely able to repeat/
That little question./

name: Panic / Addict
text:
Slow-volt spine, sinews taut/
Wrapping cords and packed/
Writhing in the marrow/
Free my snakebit muscles/
Venom-struck and tightbound/
Let me slither free/

name: Capital Is Mutable
text:
Slow-volt spine,/
Meters measured in metrics:/
Sandgrains dislodged/
Vagabonds discouraged/
Money turned monied/
To the sweet glass ground/
I’ll laugh when you fail to see your reflection/
I’ll fail to find your truth./
I’d prefer you pilfer me in the open day/
And let me slide to struggle/

name: Protest
text:
Keep calm and carry/
The narrative/
The aphorism fetches farther/
Than night shades preach/
I see when your mirage throttles the lectern/
Communes with orthodontists/
(Bless and pray the sacred science never ceases)/
Tannists, other-ists/
(seen you)/
Falls to fail in politics/
And persists/
Vacant/

name: Acquisition
text:
How to come face to face/
With a capitalist itch/
How to lend your hands - sacrificial/
Digging wealth,/
Hand it in heaps/
To your smiling, jack-faced lords/
(Yes they’ll be men)/
(Yes they’ll be clean as sheets)/
So that they (They, too, are stunned)/
May do/
As/
They so wish to do./
The firm will grip/
Your filthy hands/
With strong gaps - bovine - (eyes to match)/
Palms flexed/
In business sense/
Straining to move on/

name: High
text:
Buy me smoked, wrung out/
On the line/
Tobacco was made in the dry sun, an accident/
I am cooked the same/
Basted and blistered/
In moonless heat/
I am roughly sane/
A spoke to B and B to me/
We wrote it down We crossed it out items/
A tried some music./
B stared out the window./
My eyes gave out before my ears/
So I felt for rumblings/
Awful groans and yawns giving way/

name: Meadowlark
text:
Fascinating to watch a small bird/
Fly down the slope of a meadow/
It pauses with wigs outstretched - middle of the air -/
Then retracts its splayed feathers fast,/
Close to the body/
Picks up speed in a dive/
Its true weight revealed/
In gravity’s jolt/
Before it stretches to glide again./

This pause and sprint spaces itself/
Out along the length of the hill/
A mesmeric undulation/
The ends at the top/
Of a noisy tree./

name: Pithy
text: Whisper while you work ♫ ♪/

name: Burst
text:
Why would they call it/
A ringing?/
No one can answer./
There is neither/
Clear end nor clear beginning./
Just an eventual fade./
Missed call. Voicemail./
Ears ringing. (recuperating noise)/
This is when you learn that/
Not only your skin/
Can be numb./
Your inmost birds can screech/
With god-grafted lungs/
Straightline flat/
Unflappable tongues originating from a/
Distance fully within./

name: Train Quote
text:
I overheard a rider:/
“We’re nightfish/
Fast. Hungry.”/
We spill our tank at each stop/
And when it gets late, you know, this late -/
We don’t replenish./

I wanted to call us mannequins/
That one sits. This one stands. Casual, tall. Still./
Nobody swims./

We were a little alive, a little lifeless./
Small chatter, long stares./
Finding floors and corners/
No faces interjecting/
Maybe “fish” was right./

I don’t think I’ve ever seen one/
Look me in the eye./

name: Help
text:
They ain’t really alive…/
They AIN’T really alive they ain’t got no/
        name in no book/
Leave em be/
Don’t get killed unhappy now/
You know I can’t help you with that./
Dance the pavement, dance the street./

name: Details
text:
What’s left of a downpour?/
Raindrops caught in flared petals/
Skyfall splashed/
Into spiderwebbed dew/
Into haphazard permanence/
Before We - the sun, the bees -/
Resume entropy’s business/

Perched on outstretched stalks:/
Rigid liquid -/
A varnish spilled here, beaded there/
Little spheres, tense with geometry,/
Sweat on the lip of a jar./

name: Soliloquy
text:
Count me as a perpetual drifter of/
Stoplights and stopsigns./

Highway exits gift better/
Than city grates and subway stops./
They can exit here. Fast./
Guilt hides with time/
Or faster yet, with distance/

I took my shirt off/
Cause I knew you’d stare/
Bent kneeward, seated with business/
In my gut,/
Flesh, folded flesh/
Shoe tie tries/
Umbrellas and garbage./
You’ve seen me near dumpsters. In warm debris/
Sun scalds and bloated arms blending/

name: Identical
text:
I don’t have roots/
I was dug from the earth (molded from many clays)/
Born into lost words and/
Freefalling freedom/

I am one of those Americans bound to land/
And nowhere to place this conviction/
Schools raised me to claim/
My inheritance./
Whitman claimed I contained/
These lands in my body,/
In my expression, boundless./

Yet I, too, am colonized <contained> (contaminated?)/
I am colony, colonizer, and colonized/
I am Puerto Rican by reclamation/
By family, by blood/
Told our lands were never ours/
Shown that power wrested/
Is not soon reclaimed./

Thousands of miles away,/
I’ve sped to the coast/
Sunset chasing, not knowing/
What burned me to find/
Final bursts of the sun./
My eyes searched and scanned/
The buried horizon./
Where I saw swaths of waves/
Unclaimed/

name: Unlucky Skin
text:
Give the pluck a fucking rest/
Gimme some strum-drop-strum/
Beat, strum-drop-strum thump/
Bass and backbeat drum, stump, back weak-knee strum/
Croon a voice of country pluck/
Spread a drop of country folk, damn, wisdom/
Spill my city veins with clean, clean fold-ing/
I long til I belong, shake til I share my grave/
Numb in the mirror, mute -/
And I will strain my jaw/
Clench my teeth, my teeth to listen/
I need sound when silence spills/
I am absent/
I am gut-strung from wires/
Alight, I float/
Endometrial echoes perform orchestrally/
<Fuck that noise>/
Ban-ban-jo, rise, damn, rise, rise/
Crescendo/

name: Routine
text:
I need/
You/
To know/
My friend’s dad dropped/
Dead/
It was the pepper. It was the spray. It was/
His Body./
With the beating,/
It broke./

name: Cold Surf
text:
Cyclists surge ahead/
They see the break before you/
Doubled muni buses parting/
They ride the smooth lane/
Push for a true crescendo/
Many hills to come/

name: Home
text:
Drop/
Drop. Drop. Drop. Drop. Drop. Until you get along. You get along./
Man-eye-ick. Maniacal. Jaw/
Bone/
Cut. stone. Clench. Cut. Cut. Jaw. Awe. Awe. Ah./
That./
We./
Saw. We saw. We saw./

name: Sunday Morning
text:
Known./
I know the place that he knew./
He knew what they knew./
We were farms or horses./
They were pastors./
Or sheep. They were strong as stone./
And just as ruined. By the time/
We knelt at their altars,/
I strained. Bodybagged, Furrowed./
Lunging to dust./
I can pray or I can scream./
I mutter. Out of obedience./

name: NIMBY
text:
We were uncontained./
Do you think we chose to live in the forest?/
We don’t reject new growth/
Out of preservation./
Why should we live in the shadow now?/
We balk out of fear./

name: Haiku 1
text:
Empty./
Chatter. It’s an echo/
I never repeat/

name: Out Of My Control
text:
On a crowded train/
There are enough screens/
For me to pay attention/
<Three seconds at a time>/
To all my cares, worries and wants/
I am as shallow/
As you fear./
More intrigued by strangers/
Than strangeness/
Than my own narrow years./

name: In Focus
text:
I have found the limits/
Of my body/
The heights it will let me climb/
Hand over hand/
Limblike ladder/
Disappearing in thick canopy layers/
When I crouch in the high branches/
I find my familiar edge/
The one I find when I sprint/
Fastflown blurry track/
When I bounce, when I bound/
And I am weightless./
I sway. I float. I fly./

name: Gaunt Urgency
text:
I'm knotted inside, squeezed,/
Endlessly wringing out/
Things I try to explain discuss/
With a twisted <swollen> tongue/
I’m left enough space to breathe, just/
Enough to write/
Someday it’ll teach me to be pithy, slow/
Or indifferent/
For now I’m fastened in struggle./

name: Rarely, Me
text:
People tell me it’s an ahistorical city,/
Markov’s city,/
Everyone new taking and trading places/
Lined up, short line, long line, or next./
Always next./
Everyone old is waiting, trapped or relieved./
Success or failure, I meant it: relieved./
The unsettled increasingly move/
Their unsettling rattles neighbors/
Their moves make me shudder./
I might be them,/
I should listen,/
But always I do look past them/
I can nod with definition,/
Almost certain/
Yet always I do look past them./

name: Anthropology
text:
Lands seem to lock with language/
Rolling, agitated, calm, brusque/
Peoples with their earth/
I can see them/
Firmly grasping soil,/
    Damp, freshly tilled/
Briskly walking contours by intuition./

Many crave this understanding/
Expansive and deep/
For centuries, a family rests/
Where it remains./
Until a child grows too restless,/
Cannot maintain the charade/
Planted fields dry up - stubborn husks/
Cling to the end./
Yet roots, too, wither./
People roam./
They trade waters, populate new homes/
Find another landscape calling./

name: Villa
text:
It’s almost a matter of spacing,/
Of setting expectations./
Delicately set in spacious rows/
Olive trees quilt the curvilinear grounds./
To the west, limestone slabs/
Nestle between the leaves/
Flatten a slope and frame/
A soft blue pool/
Cypress trees trace a line/
To a date tree, tall, symmetric/
Standing proud beside the cornerstone:/
Whitewashed villa, weathered Spanish tiles/
Lush vines climbing columns/
By the terraced lawn/
And a view of the valley, the gorge/
The canyon walls, vineyards/
And ancient city:/
Ronda desde el campo/
Mi corazón canta y sueña de ti/

name: Granada
text:
Before you arrived/
There was greenery flanked by reddish cliffs/
When you arrived, a separate vision grew./
You ordered the iron clay molded/
The layered stone extracted./
You lifted walls, minarets/
From the earth below/
And left savage trees crowding/
Stark fortifications./

Within, you hid miracles,
Developed the mathematics of symmetry/
Carved truths./
You set water to exalted motion/
Softened its touch on marble,/
And scented the air with jasmine./

Centuries of disrepair did nothing/
But increase its splendor/
Imagined colors shine brighter/
Pictured trees, gardens, rooms/
All living vividly in this monument/
The awe of millions preserves this legacy./

name: Preacher I
text:
Posture is less important than posturing/
Morally and physically/
Structural integrity can be feigned/
And should be./
Belief in this underpinning/
Drives our technology, our politics, our construction./
We draw lines in the sand./
To show our mettle/
When the wind erases them/
We look somewhere else - a more recent line?/
Another stretch of beach?/

name: Allowance
text:
I grew up without one/
And I grew up with all of them/
Is that an oxymoron?/
Doubt is the gray area I thrived in/
I got the benefit/
And I still do./

name: Short Circuit
text:
Write before the editor/
Use what you can use/
Flute song, light beer, head in the clear/
Reacting cold, uncollected/
Quick spark running, fuzzy electric/
In your shoulder/
If you forgot the breaker, fuck it/

name: Impulse
text:
Stone sprung bone/
Whispers in the glass box/
Funny swingtime looped/
Happy, happy, happy time lapse/
Gertrude stein with wine box, with a wine box/
Gingembre breaking songs/
Mix, mix it and lay low/

name: Whit
text:
I know and I know/
We make a life out of our excess,/
We are uncontained, or can be./
We are the world’s inheritance/
We know/
What they cannot./

name: Etymological Oddities
text:
You don’t need to climb too high/
To notice how small you are/
Eight or nine feet will do/
You don’t need to sink too low/
To notice how tall you’ve been/
Someone in the middle might say this/
Half involved in their own life/
Watching themselves play out brevity/
And its skirmishes with meaning./
Many metaphors meant many people,/
Or fractions of people/
Saw each other’s moons askew/
Their errors writ large, writ law/
Lunatics come no more from the heavens/
Than they do from the dirt/

name: Brachial
text:
Our days as a collection of surfaces/
Textures that bend with us, soothe us/
Couches, beaches, beds/
Textures that don’t relent/
Benches, pavement, walls./
My day as electric./
Give me a tension that draws/
As much charge as it gives/
My day as desire./
Track, flesh, lover./

name: My Body is a Vessel That I Will Break
text:
I’m aging into fears/
Doubts left unexplored./
Beginning to worry/
I’ve been crossing lines/
Everyone else could already see/
Tiptoeing high branches/
	(Head in the clouds)/
Trespassing pathways/
	(Head in the dirt)/
My muscles alerted me first/
Told me how unsure I was becoming./
How tired. How unbalanced./

name: Excerpt
text:
To stare at the ocean/
	In ebriation/
Is to know frustration/
	In repetition./

name: Conditional
text:
With each act of faith/
There’s an act of disapperance/
I let one group fade and try to assume my other/
That side of public disagreement/
Denial, undermining/
If I can blend it away/
If I can speak just right/
If I can listen/
I can be among you/
I can convince myself/
I can forget my shell, my face, my mask./

name: Retinue
text:
My eyes are filled with a color -/
Something close to blue./
Gray shirts and  jackets drain them/
Like a midday fog dimly draped/

name: Hobbled
text:
I ran flat-footed/
Pale and proud, Ankle barely flexed/
or flushed with exertion. I ran in circles, tight/
With preferences solitude. This is when/
I knew I would die first. This when I knew/
I could hardly change. This had been my groove. For years./
Another’s rut. Another’s canyon deep. My smooth./

name: Absentminded
text:
I can’t tell you how often my afterthought/
is context/
I blurt mid-rabbit hole into pronouncement/
I pause straining for/
a rewind click/
Thoughts don’t come collected/
So I call for them, trace them/
And recall them,/
in your proximity,/
In my past voice,/
More recital than explanation./

name: Even Keeled, Kempt
text:
My mind can and will implode/
But not before my eyes burst/
Internal pressure, veins stifling/
Breath and grinding teeth down/
Either that, or too exasperated,/
I’ll wave my flag of beat relief/
Power down, lay horizontal fade./

name: Waste Product
text:
What mind wants to see the world/
Through a grid, this prison turned prism/
That does more to delight/
Than to illuminate/
(False soothsayer)/
I’m tired of data, equations and calculation/
If I don’t generate ideas, I’m a shitty computer/
Let the machine do what it does better/
I’ll sleep, wander, taste and fuck/

name: Brainlag
text:
The way your blood settles/
Into timezones/
The quiet limits of body/
And invention/
The strength of orbits/
And spheres./
We belong to where we’ve been/
Sundown, stomach sluggish/
Vaulted into passive airspace/
Tough footing slowly found/
We stumble until we crash/
On couches or pillows/
In malingering afternoons/

name: Scales
text:
Tall grasses matted down/
Into creekside cushions,/
Cross-legged, I sit in hopes of rest/
With a weariness that doesn’t translate./
There is a new world beneath me,/
Shaded reprieve of minuscule passageways,/
Canyons/
I do not know how far a beetle scurries/
Each hour, each day./
Condors drift lifetimes in flight/
I spend years in search of quiet spots/
Places unconcerned with footsteps./

name: Skinned
text:
Nighthorn, visceral, low/
Resonant, dripping, dripping angelic/
My worries flatlined into floor vents/
I pulsed picturesque, waiting,/
Waiting for some time, hopeful,/
Melancholic, a drifter surrounded by purpose/
Propped into the light/
Some vestigial impulse/
Surviving in me./

name: Drawing Breath
text:
I am closely patterned/
These last evenings tiptoe/
Next to flames, beards drawn/
Out to wisps, baggy eyes/
And wrinkles, singed./

name: Pity
text: Whisper while you hurt/

name: On Watching
text:
I notice evening shadows/
Do not fall or creep or inch/
I do not have the attention/
To see them in such real time/
I am distracted/
I see them in snapshots/
Markers, measurements, rooftops/
Snapshots, darkness./
Nothing else seems to change so slowly./

name: On Resting In the Woods
text:
At the end of overgrown paths/
I take my halting rest,/
Close enough to the main route that/
Voices tether loose loops/
To my ears, sliding free/
As they march forward/
Another few feet/
Often I am hid at a vantage/
Well above, as branches, as birds/
I feel solitary, aware of limits/
Shoulders to fingers/
More ground than sky/
I am tethered in a harsher way/
Internally chaotic and still./

name: Habituated
text:
I appear more doomed to repeat myself/
Than I couldve ever believed/
Change. Ferns. Redwoods. Birds./
Tired sleep. Contractions. Contraptions. Solitude./

name: Sunspot
text:
Find me an afternoon/
That teeters on the edge of warmth/
The type of day where cold feet and old cats/
Search for sunspots on the carper/
Where heat grows only/
From stillness and patience./
In these hours, you’ll find me/
In a windless nook of the woods,/
Sunlit, letting my cotton t-shirt shoulders/
Launder and bake into reptilian comfort./
I’ll stand in this clearing, unmoving,/
Until the shadows angle/
Or the breeze/
Shows me another forest window./

name: Envy is Empty I
text:
I know how to be wealth adjacent/
Almost rubbing shoulders, but I will always,/
Unkempt, push away into wildernesses,/
Reassociate with my brethren branches,/
Leaves and foliage. I claim my hilltop/
Opposite the fenced and manicured/
Withering their bald rooftops and/
Vacuumed lawns with disappointment across the valley/
To create vacant spaces out bounty:/
This is the proprietary trick of the rich/
I see ravens, circling, channeling,/
Vulturing. They, too, sense a carcass./

name: Trace The Line
text:
Bluegrass, careful, unequivocal/
Spiky here, shaved there/
Earthfur bristling, shivering/
Cold in summer’s windy fever/
There is a gradual slope of green/
That picks up speed and picks up steam/
And careens into a cliff/
Whose bottom I dare not see/
By that precipice/
The patchy weeds/
Tell me there is no depth to this soil/
Nothing firm in the footing/
I should retreat to the shadow of trees/
Lean against them/
Let my page wonder what goes on below/

name: Monarch
text:
Vantage, defense, distance/
Motives of those who/
Move to the hills/
Never seem to change./

name: A Kind of Prayer
text:
Wooden picnic bench/
Slowly encroached by shade/
Your planks are weathering/
Varnish long stripped/
Pollen dust layered./

Where termites gnawed you down/
You’re starting to look more like the tree/
You once were, or would have become, ridges of outer bark/
Smoothed and splintered/
Spider webbed/
Base wreathed in the vertebrate husks of pine leaves./

Carefully sat, in spots,/
You can still support a body./

name: (Di)splayed
text:
Battered minds with my brain still spinning/
In elliptically undulating circles/
Cryptically seizing epileptic flashes/
That mean literally nothing./
Jumbles travel in the wake of my word/
Spew. I drift catatonic on broken/
Emblems and snapshot pendants/

name: Matrilineal
text:
I may live my days out in a mirrored exile/
Flipside of the longitudinal globa/
Straddled underneath the equator/
Looking up, looking back, misplaced/
Regret/
Stuck in a thread of powerful impulse/
Frozen after quick, matrilineal./

name: Koan I
text:
Is there anything more finicky/
Than a butterfly/
Flitting from spot to spot?/

name: Philosophy
text:
I knew that could’ve been should’ve been me/
Living in the past, life on the line/
Drafted into unthought ideals,/
I was 18. They were 18. I was there. Would’ve been there./
Not enough questions. Not enough doubt./

name: March
text:
I was never one to shy away from a physical contest/
Consequence never conquered impulse./
I’d be susceptible, sometimes successful,/
Final./
Order would scare my skull into wide-eyed submission./
Soldier. Frighted. Dead./

name: Is It True?
text:
Crickets do not belong/
Only to the night/

On cloudy days/
Hear them chirp in river pocket and pond marsh/
Metronomes mourning the dark./

name: What Little Fate
text:
Little orange, sat, navel up/
In the corner of the sidewalk patch,/
Dirt surrounded by fruitless trees./
What inspiration/
What little fate/
Brought you shining here/
By method or mistake./

name: Rare Earth Exhaust
text:
Why they snuck into rattles, twigs/
Thin filaments. gray, rising./
I am filthy. I am famished./
Chalky stone and sediment/
Rainy wash in scrubland woods/
Deer trail and footpath/

name: Lost Cause
text:
A moment past me patient waiting in nature/
A kind of endeavor stirs in my feet, my fingers/
A curiosity to learn how I interact/

Where can I glide?/
Where am I just noise?/
Will my limbs pull me skyward in oaken arms?/
Will my stone skip as smooth, fast, effortless, inevitable/
As the wave that will consume it?/

name: Sunshade
text:
What thoughtful, lively shade:/
Flickering around pocketed moss,/
Little specks reflected/
Green, then darkly green/

name: Bombast
text:
Twin beyond twining/
Spherical double & orbital flow/
Spirit beyond reason, vacantly slow/

name: Acquired Taste
text:
Neither simple. Neither complex./
Off by one matchstrike, rough scratch/
Click and lit. Flint? Sulfur?/
Wonder in maneuver. Overt. Latent./
Crisp arrival./

name: Cottonwood
text:
Foothold, handhold, free climb/
Into sandpaper bark, branches/
Yawning into reversed submission,/
Gravity on a yielding load/
Reaching, stretching, sagging, tired/
Memory of an iron touch/

name: Sequoia
text:
To be wrinkled patterned and smooth/
Charred/

Malleable pumice/
Melting sandstone/
With dead logs, bright pine sprouts/
Filling the darkened spaces/
Voids of winter/
Spring arrival/

name: Envy is Empty II
text:
Near wealth, your poverty implicates estrangement/
Your tilted, swiveling head,/
Your pauses and lack of boredom./
You haven’t spent enough time here/
To recognize how little they care for their situation./
They too are petty./
They too are insecure,/
They too will be forgotten/

name: Hypothesis
text:
I imagine the body/
At Death’s mantle turns inward, breathes (heaves?)/
Clicks the lights off once more. And right then/
Its cavern grows electric/
Fuzzed in that just dark glow/
Last lights leave eyes/
And the gentle doors close/
Let me pass with the falling of leaves and trees/

name: Overstated
text:
I can replenish my mind with a color/
Noisy, layered light/
In flat glows/
Blurry diagrams/
Of breezy intersections/
I can refresh my mind with a color/
Amorphous maps of/
Shadow/
Setting, resetting/
Disappearing./
A settling pool of shadows/
Soon to find its stillness/
I am partly submerged, partly breathing/
Spines, tendrils, stalks/
Exposed phylum, stony lichen/

name: Texan Clatter
text:
Cobwebs turn to lint/
And there is nothing on the vine/
A dry constriction/
Patchwork of a helix past/
Armadillo scurry and dig/
Voronoi body and rat tail/
Suspended leaf on a single thread/
Twirl and swing, dancing/
Something stoic and dark and small watches/
A tumor in the forest. A stone’s throw/
Paralytic, transfixed./

name: Foggy Rhythm
text:
Slant brain crooked couldn’t elect/
a lattice, rustic, slow in my process/
leaf, left, laughed, I am slow/
And terrible, and slower still./
A shadow crept, rhyme verse flat/
In ferns/
A bitter, bitter linger/
A chalky, sunken chill/
I am flat and sunken and slower still./

name: At 31
text:
I walk in a waking way/
With cause and a careless triumph/

name: Boat in the Harbor
text:
Untethered. Not cut loose in a falling dive/
Not freed from a bound mind with a glimpse of revelation/
Frayed/
Cord chafed gradually threadbare/
Buoy adrift/

name: Elutropea
text:
A maze of sameness, likenesses/
Replayed, replayed, replaced/
My eye is not trained/
My right hand is fossilizing/
Displays, resplendent, asleep/

name: Finale
text:
A written note, a writ, rote/
Rupture, ripped, played with/
Smoke, wound up smote,/
Pages felled, then filled, flipped/
Through, one by one by one by two/
A singsong psalm went on a year too long/

name: Winter Sun
text:
The wind is in all four facets of bloom/
Flow and weave, cold cheek/
With a warm temple/

These lines are inlets/
Coves eroding caves/

A cicada sounds like electricity/
Constant, thrumming crackle/
A gust sounds like oncoming traffic/
My frame of reference is inverted, denatured/
I walk where I’d rather ramble/

A sense of life and lovely loss/
Rotten rind and apple blossom/

name: Spontaneity
text:
Rare abundance turning corners/
Nooks of laughter, discovery/

Pastoral - image of the lamb and land/
Tearing bread, spongy flesh/

name: Magnolia
text:
Broad-leafed olive awning/
Chalky lichen wrapping limbs/
Wide-trunk/
Ferned, felt-tipped and knitted bud/
Thick calligraphy drawing layered blooms/
Magenta into majesty/

name: Fragments
text:
Humid teatime vapor, phosphorescent blue, color burned sky/
A stagnant afternoon, trees clenched - tensed - flexed/
Shimmering signals, noise/buzz, dehydrated vision, glared - staticked/
I select circumstances avocal - implicit/
It’s been awhile since I operated in thought, not snapshot/
Tearing the veil of continuity disrupts my being, threatens my existence/
Living in lists, tasks, fragments, out of flow/
Separated from myself, automaton, Markov state by state, discretized/
Soon to be discontinued unless I release my striated illusion/
I am one, unified, languid or lurching, leaping/
I am mid-flight, my path in custom motion/

name: Admittance
text:
Under the canopy, move/
Slow, crouch/
Weak limbs/
Heavy inhalations/
Exhaustion/
Unfolding into common gesture/
Rigid plank of a body/
A physical ordination, blessing/
Of shade, soil/
Undergrowth embracing collapse/

name: Parabola
text:
My neck flinches - skeletal tick/
Terrified by the fog/
That shrouds me/
My thoughts evaporate/
Single phrase, maybe a sentence/
I cannot carry this frailty/
Cannot change it/
My body/
This only thing left of me/

name: On Falling
text:
I am never at ease/
I examine less and less/
A man in action/
Animal tumult/
Remove structure and I bristle/
Burn into fixation/
I, nauseous passenger,/
Mid-fall/
Glancing anywhere but down/

name: It is Enough
text:
Trees, their nests, branches/
These are sufficient joys/
Root, stream, source and filter/
What is necessary/
I will never understand/
Each forest, aloof/
Present and plainly so/

name: Frank
text:
Mouse, cat, man/
Sequence of quiet/
Long line after the writhing/
A body for the compost/
One for the grave, one for the sea/
One hundred, one and young/
Scared, unaware, and the last, prepared./
A day changes little/
A century changes less than you might think./
Steady - time, for him, was strong and slow/
And he was for me, for a decade, time./
Ten years since, one year until…/
He made it, he missed her - their love, their time/
He saw her in the room, he’ll meet her in the sea/

name: Koan II
text: Flurry of rain, mist, quickly cool/

name: On Longing
text:
I want to wield clarity/
Unburdened motion/
Recollected scythe/
I want to be mid-field/
Certain again, sweating/
In the churn of unearthed minutiae/
This has led somewhere/
Could lead elsewhere/
